newsitem.title: USA: Hilton to buy Prudential stake in hotels.
newsitem.headline: Hilton to buy Prudential stake in hotels.

text.p: Hilton Hotels Corp said it agreed to acquire the majority of Prudential Insurance Co of America 's interest in two properties operating under the Hilton name for $163 million.

In a statement issued late Thursday, Hilton said it would purchase the stakes in the 1,543-room Chicago Hilton & Towers and the 1,895-room San Francisco Hilton & Towers as part of an expansion into full-service hotels.
Prudential, meanwhile, agreed to purchase Hilton's 10 percent interest in the 500-room Miami Airport Hilton for an undisclosed sum.
Hilton owns 33.3 percent of the Chicago property and 50 percent of San Francisco hotel.
The deal is expected to close in the third quarter of 1996.
